column4: hey, is there any reason why when I set ubuntu to auto-login, the screen is zoomed in, but when I log in normally it isnt?
what do you mean by zoomed in??
Keith, that sort of thinking wont get anything working
Keith, nor will you learn anything
paddy_EIRE:  Its confusing to explain, but its as if the screen size is slightly bigger than the monitor, and when I go to the edges it scolls over a tiny bit to see the edges
paddy_EIRE:  Its really hard to explain
do you have an auto-adjust button on your monitor?
Yes, and that doesnt fix it
and whats weirder is that when I log in normally everything is fine
Paddy_EIRE:or if I log out and log back in
Paddy_EIRE:Okay that seems to have fixed it.  Its unclear how that would get changed based on how I log in though
could be the way your session is being saved?
when you have it running the way you like it to start on first login hold alt and press f2 then type gnome-save-session
possibly, I didnt change any of those settings my self
